adjectives.description: consecrate (comparative more consecrate, superlative most consecrate)

examples: They were assembled in that consecrate place.

verbs.description: consecrate (third-person singular simple present consecrates, present participle consecrating, simple past and past participle consecrated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To declare something holy, or make it holy by some procedure.
examples: Synonyms: behallow, hallow; see also Thesaurus:consecrate
Antonyms: desecrate, defile; see also Thesaurus:desecrate

entries.meaning: (transitive, Roman Catholicism, specifically) To ordain as a bishop.
